page.title: 07All Saints' Church, Wing
page.content: Inside the church the altar is surrounded by stained glass windows. In front of it are two tombs. One is for Robert Dormer, who was the Lord of the Manor and who died in 1552. In the Lady Chapel there is a cross which is dedicated to George Draper, who was the churchwarden for 15 years and who died in 1891. In the grounds of the church is a wooden gateway dedicated to Francis Henry Tatham, who was the priest in 1890. On the other side of the gateway is some Latin writing, which means "For God so loved the world", from St. John.
